frame.name: Coming_up_with
frame.definition:
<def-root>Words in this frame have to do with a <fen>Cognizer</fen> creating a new intellectual entity, the <fen>Idea</fen>. These words are similar to words of physical creation such as <ment>build</ment> and <ment>make</ment>, and in some cases may be understood as metaphorically based on such words. However, the <fen>Idea</fen>s in this frame are predominantly conceptual in nature.
Compare this frame with Achieving_first. In that frame, the fact that the idea is new to society is emphasized, whereas Coming_up_with refers to an agentive <fen>Cognizer</fen> using mental effort to figure something out, without any implication of the impact of the idea.
<ex><fex name="Cog">I</fex> 've been trying to <t>come up</t> <fex name="Idea">with a plan</fex> .</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>Cognizer is the person who comes up with or conceptualizes the Invention. It is normally expressed as an External Argument:
<fex name="Cognizer">Kim</fex> <t>devised</t> a new recipe. </def-root>

FE.name: Idea
FE.definition:
<def-root>Invention is the intellectual creation of the Cognizer. It is normally expressed as an NP Object, but sometimes as a PP Complement:
<ex>Kim <t>devised</t> <fex name="Idea">a new recipe</fex>. </ex>
<ex>Kim <t>came up</t> <fex name="Idea">with a new recipe</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>Some of the words in this frame frequently occur with a constituent expressing the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Idea</fen> is intended. Normally this constituent is a PP Complement headed by <ment>for</ment> or a <ment>to</ment>-marked VP Complement:
<ex>This car has been <t>designed</t> <fex name="Purpose">for quicker performance</fex>.</ex> <ex>Kim <t>created</t> this plan <fex name="Purp">to prevent a hostile takeover</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition:
<def-root>Words in this frame sometimes occur with a constituent that expresses the intellectual material from which the <fen>Idea</fen> is created. This frame element is characteristic of physical creation verbs like <ment>make</ment>; its presence gives sentences in this frame an especially strong metaphorical quality. The <fen>Material</fen> FE is normally expressed by a PP Complement headed by <ment>from</ment> or <ment>out of</ment>:
<ex>The composer <t>created</t> the symphony <fex name="Material">out of snippets of popular melodies</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Amount_of_progress
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> succeeds in coming up with the idea.
<ex>Before he could even <fex name="Degr">half-way</fex> <t>improvise</t> a response, she moved on.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of a focal participant during the time the invention takes place. <ex>The Arvanids <t>concocted</t> a desperate plan to break the siege, <fex name="Dep">unaware that the Ahurmids themselves were starving</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>A state of the Cognizer that directly and palpably influences the overall action.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An act performed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> that contributes to the creation of the <fen>Idea</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Location_of_appearance
FE.definition:
<def-root>(This FE belongs in Achieving_first, not here.)
</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> comes up with the <fen>Idea</fen>.
<ex>She had <t>cooked up</t> the story <fex name="Place">in Pisa</fex>, before she even left Italy.</ex>
The following belongs in Achieving_first:
<ex>Sandboarding was <t>invented</t> <fex name="Place">in Florianopolis, Brasil</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Idea</fen> is created.
<ex>You had better <t>hatch</t> some plans <fex name="Time">before you get there</fex>.</ex>
The following belongs in Achieving_first:
<ex>Toilet paper was <t>invented</t> <fex name="Time">in 1857</fex></ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: conceive.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: devise in the mind; imagine

lexUnit.name: concoct.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: create or devise (a story or plan)

lexUnit.name: concoction.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process or result of creating or devising (a story or plan)

lexUnit.name: contrivance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of devising or planning something using skill and artifice.

lexUnit.name: contrive.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: devise or plan using skill and artifice

lexUnit.name: cook up.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: concoct a story, excuse, or plan, especially an ingenious or devious one.

lexUnit.name: design.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to invent, plan something for a particular purpose

lexUnit.name: devise.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: plan or invent (a complex procedure or mechanism).

lexUnit.name: hatch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: conspire to devise (a plot or plan).

lexUnit.name: improvise.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: produce or make (something) from whatever is available.

lexUnit.name: invent.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make up (a name, story, plan, etc.)

lexUnit.name: invention [process].n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action of creating, making up, or designing something

lexUnit.name: come up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: invent; make up (an idea, a story, etc.)

lexUnit.name: think up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: come up with (an idea, a story, etc.)

lexUnit.name: design.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the art or action of conceiving of and producing a plan or drawing before something is built

lexUnit.name: invention [artifact].n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the entity produced by the invention process.

lexUnit.name: find.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to arrive at an idea
